Key Match Events: Nick Castellanos hit a walk-off single to left field to score Trea Turner from second base in a 7-6 victory over the Mets in Game 2 of the National League Division Series.
Bryce Harper crushed a two-run homer to center field in the sixth inning against Luis Severino to cut the Phillies’ deficit to 3-2.
Brandon Nimmo hit a go-ahead homer against Orion Kerkering in the seventh.
Mark Vientos hit a two-run homer against Matt Strahm in the ninth to tie the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Nick Castellanos expressed his joy at saving the Phillies’ season and the significance of the moment for his family.
Rob Thomson praised Castellanos' resilience and hitting ability.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game represented Castellanos’ entire season, as he struggled early in the season but improved significantly.
The Phillies’ offense had been virtually nonexistent in the NLDS before Castellanos' heroics.
Others: The Phillies scored three runs in the eighth to take a 6-4 lead.
Matt Strahm allowed a two-run homer to Mark Vientos in the ninth to tie the game.
